messages.content:
"Gah! What the hell does normal circumstances mean!"
Selle briskly rises from the couch and yells out loud, scratching at their head.
*Shit! I just shouted that out loud.*
"Morning. What are you talking about?" Erik.

Selle sighs. 
"...Don't worry about it. Good morning, glad to see that you got out fine. I ended up almost bleeding out on the way here, but I'm somehow fine. It's gonna leave a nasty scar."
Selle winces a bit at the still healing wound.
"This girl you were crashing with… She’s got quite a few connections, huh? I had a little look through her things."
"Sure does. Probably the most "neutral" person around, bar myself. She's practically the only reason I still have money."

"Don't look through my stuff, asshole. You're banned now." Laura grumbles angrily as she leaves her room. 

"Sorry, sorry... Didn't mean anything by it. Except that I think you could help us with our monster problem." Erik.

"That's a good point, actually." 
Selle sits up and rubs their eyes.
"I almost forgot that we're still dealing with that thing, Grognaut was it's name?"

"Never heard of a monster like that." Laura shrugs.

"Well, regardless... It's incredibly powerful. We'd need backup, realistically. Backup you seem to be able to provide." Erik.

"We watched it completely slice the head off a person right in front of us. Not to mention how it seemingly went and killed a whole crowd of people in a bar, at first, which is why I was even tipped off about it."
Selle scratches their head.
"Actually, now that I'm thinking about it, the person we saw die. They... came back to life somehow. My brain has been kind of in denial regarding that but, I'm sure of it. I... don't think it's related to the monster itself though."

"There are some spells to do it if you’re fast but they’re expensive, risky, and with a short time window." Erik.

"Whatever, I’ll ask my uncle I guess." Laura goes silent.

"Thank you. I greatly appreciate the assistance that you've given me so far."
Selle gives a smile.
"Anyway. Erik, how did you manage to get out of your situation yesterday? Did anything happen while I was getting dragged away?"

"I had to get a bit sneaky, is all. That high priestess is one tough fighter." He crosses his arms.

"Alright, I've got your answer. Come on." Laura gets up, looking annoyed. "Apparently I have to come too."

*...This might be more troublesome than I thought.*
Selle puts their things on.
"Alright. Let's see how this goes."
Laura heads out. Erik follows.
Selle follows also.
Erik suddenly stops. "Wait. Everyone stay silent."

*...is it what I think it is?*
Selle is silent.
Erik stealthily creeps forward and turns a corner. Laura chases after him.
Selle does the same with a focused expression.
((Roll stealth))

Grognaut is asleep on the ground ahead.

Erik approaches it with a sword at the ready.

"What the fuck is that thing!?!?" Laura shouts.

Grognaut suddenly begins to move. "Hmm…?"

In a panic, Erik plunges his sword into the monster’s chest.

*Damn it! What the fuck do we do now?*
With an annoyed expression, Selle runs up to Erik, and casts Prestidigitation to disorientate Grognaut with a heavy bright light.

Grognaut knocks Erik away in a panic.

Erik lands skillfully, looking largely unhurt somehow.

Grognaut begins weeping pathetically in pain.
Selle looks over at Laura, to gauge how she's feeling about the situation.
She’s just kind of grossed out.
"It's... crying? Erik, you're leading now, what are we gonna do about this?"
Selle is in a bit of a panic.

"Finishing it off!" Erik leaps into the air and attempts to drop kick the sword still stuck in Grognaut’s chest. He misses the sword, but his feet hit Grognaut and the force of this impact sends him crashing through a wall. 

"Waaaaah! Don’t hurt Grognauuuut!" Grognaut aimlessly attempts to swipe at the air to keep them at bay.

"It’s like… A baby. A giant muscly baby." Laura.

Selle braces themselves after the massive impact of Grognaut flying through the wall.
"It sure is. Big ass fucking baby."
Selle runs over to help Erik, ready to use magic if need be.

Erik pulls out the sword from Grognaut’s chest and swings it at its neck, only coming close enough to leave a scratch. "Really? That’s the best you can do?" His tone is strangely monotone. There’s no hint of feeling anywhere. It’s like a chore to him. "Why were you chosen if all you can do is punch hard? You’re disappointing me."

*...what? What is he saying? Does he know something? Wait a second. I mean. I barely know anything about him anyway... We both know nothing about each other. I am barely even who I say I am. I mean, fuck.*
Selle scratches at their head, trying not to get into a spiral.
"Erik! What's going on?"

"What are you talking about? I’m killing this monster." He slashes at it again with his sword.

The symbol of cancer appears behind Grognaut in a strange dark light.

*the Order of Cancer?! Shit. What the hell!*
Selle is in a state of confusion.

Then begin to flap like wings and Grognaut is sent flying away down the corridor of the catacombs.

"There we go." Erik chases after him.

"??????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????"
Selle follows Erik.
*Okay okay okay. So. Wait. Just... Fuck! Wait one second there's too much going on! the zodiac for Cancer?! I mean, shit I guess that doesn't contradict any kind of logical sense but what the fuck does that mean? I assumed it was related to the Order of Cancer or some sort of magic related to them? But, gah! Whatever! I'll figure out more later.*
Selle looks back to see what Laura is doing during all of this.

Laura is following. She seems to be concentrating on something.

Grognaut’s flight path is a mess. He collides with several walls and exerts as much grace as a child walking for the first time.

*God, it really is like a big flying child. But why the hell is it even flying??*
Selle keeps running after the two, trying to avoid any falling debris.
"I told my uncle to cut off its escape. We’ve just gotta follow." Laura.
"Good work... God, what the hell even is that thing."
"A freaky mutant, I guess?"

"Are you familiar with that kind of thing? This is the first time I've..."
Selle stops talking suddenly.
*That's not true. Some people would consider someone like me a mutant too.* 
"Never mind. Let's keep going"

An onslaught of arrows suddenly shoots Grognaut out of the air, sending him crashing to the ground. Bob Craig tosses a net over it, ensnaring it in place.

"Leave Grognaut alone!!!!" He struggles aimlessly.

"Thank god. They finally caught it."
Selle stops and catches their breath.
"And you’re right back to disappointing me." Erik approaches Grognaut, sword at the ready.
"You've said that twice now. Did your memory regarding this thing come back?"

Erik ignores Selle. "Goodbye, beast." He swings his sword at its head, but instead strikes an invisible wall.

"Sorry, sorry! Nothing personal!" Donald’s voice comes from behind Selle. "But our boss has got some interest in that monster there, so I’ve gotta ask for him all polite-like." 

The Craig family gangsters all aim their crossbows at Donald.

*Shit, I knew this would happen when Laura brought up her uncle.*
Selle steps to the side to make sure they aren't in the line of fire.
"Donald?"

"What? You can’t seriously tell me the Craig family’s stupid enough to pick a fight with the hellhounds! You’d all have been wiped off the map a long time ago if you didn’t know when to bow your heads." Donald carelessly approaches the captured Grognaut.

"No one has to know what went down in these secluded catacombs. You’re all alone." Bob Craig.

Donald starts laughing, before eventually looking at his enemy with a dead serious expression. "I wouldn’t even need to try."

*Tch. This is my fault. I shouldn't have gone along with the plan to use Laura's connections to get the monster.*
Selle doesn't want to get involved in their dispute, and stays quiet for the time being, looking around at the faces of Laura and Erik.

Erik seems to be struggling to escape an invisible box.

Donald pulls out a deck of cards for some reason.

Laura seems to be focused on something.
"...I knew I had a bad feeling following along with Erik's idea. Whatever. Donald. What are you going to do with this thing if you take it back with you?"
"The boss wants to fight it. That simple enough for you?"
"Hah. Yeah sure, that works."
Selle shrugs.

Donald pulls out a card from his deck, which somehow transforms the net and Grognaut into a small bag. "Be seeing you!" An arrow sinks into his side. "Oh, motherfucker…"

The other members of the Craig family follow the lead of this lone bowman and begin shooting more arrows at Donald.

In a panic, Laura runs towards her uncle.

*Fuck! Trigger happy as all hell.*
"Wait wait wait wait stop stop stop!"
Selle shouts while trying not to get hit by the arrows.
The arrows that hit Donald are sent flying back at the mobsters. ((Roll medicine))
Selle can’t identify what the hell Donald’s body just did.

*Some sort of magic? What the hell was that?*
"Laura, get down!" 
Selle yells.

The Craig family men fall to the ground, dead. 

Only Bob is left. He falls to the ground, bleeding heavily as he crawls away. "Y-You beast! You’re the same as that monster!" He takes out a sword holding it out threateningly.

"Let this go, Donald! You’re not in danger!" Laura shouts in a panic.

Donald ignores her, pocketing the bag.

"Donald. Just.... Urgh. Just go, just leave. Please, go back, take the stupid fucking monster."
Selle is feeling sick, and holds onto the wall to not fall over.
*God. God damnit. What the hell could I have even done? Am i just fated to constantly see people in front of me die, and die and die and die and die?! Fuck!* 
Selle holds back a feeling of wanting to vomit.

"I was planning on it. But I’ve got some parting words for old Craig here." Donald approaches them. "You’re right in a sense. Me and this guy definitely have got a link. Never met the guy until now, but we’re clearly cut from the same cloth. The same people made us who we are now. But here’s what you’re too dumb to get. This cursed little guy you were trying to kill is only 2 years old. You’ve got nothing on me." 

Laura stands between Donald and her uncle furiously.

Donald smirks and hands her a card, before casually walking away towards the exit.
Selle is dumbfounded.

Donald salutes Selle and vanishes down the corridors.

"Whatever you do, don’t turn that card over." Erik finally escapes his little box.

"That fraud... Shit, this is my fault. Damn it! Laura. Listen to Erik, don't do anything with that card. Fuck!"
Selle slumps down against the wall and slams it with their bandaged fist.
"What a fucked up week... Absolutely powerless. What am I even still alive for?"
"We’re going to get that monster. And this time that freak won’t get the jump on us." Erik paces, deep in thought.

"Erik. There's no monster to "get" anymore. He's practically already dead... Ugh. Even saying the word makes me sick."
Selle stands up and walks over to Laura.
"I'm sorry. This is my fault. I was too careless. I've been too careless this whole time."
Selle lowers their head a little.
" I... I still don't really understand why I'm still alive. Not just because of the past week, but, for a while now. I, no, "me" as an existence, probably died a while ago, and I've been kept here, alive, just, through a feeling of zealousness. I've been living vicariously through the desire for "justice", while I strive for some sort of "great ideals" and speak of them so fondly, and yet, "I" don't even exist. I can't even stop the people around me from dying. What am I doing..."
Selle squats down on the ground after glancing at all of the corpses.
"I'm not cut out for this. I'm not cut out for this at all! I'm just some silver-spooned little fucking baby who hasn't matured past the age of 12! I "died" 9 years ago, with my only friend and with my parents! I've never moved on past then. I've put it all to blame against this stupid mythical idea of something that doesn't exist in the form of God and never thought to think about what I'm doing with my own very existence. I don't even have a concrete sense of self! I don't have a fucking name! I don't understand what is going on with my own body, what my sense of self is even supposed to be, whether I am a man, a woman, neither, or some other fucking inbetween of all of those, constantly changing! Nobody can even comprehend who I am or what or why? So, I'm sorry. I'm fucking sorry, okay?"
Selle is silent for a bit.
"All this for a bit of fucking money. Everyone can go eat shit. There's medical equipment in my satchel... Let me be alone for a bit."
Selle throws her satchel on the ground next to Laura and walks off in an indeterminate direction, for now.
((End session))
Selle is alone.

"..."
Selle is away from the rest, sitting on the floor and staring at their palm.
*There wasn't any need for all of that to happen. My complacency, my feeling that maybe, just maybe, something could be changed this time. It led to this. But, yet, I feel like I need to stand up against it. Why? Why do I feel this way? Why do I have such a suicidally pitiful sense of justice that leads me to want to "change things" when I know I'm only going along with the 'flow' and am no different from anyone else.*
Selle lifts their head up and stares up, and starts speaking out loud, to nobody in particular.
"Haha... What a pitiful person I am. Maybe this is my personal divine punishment, for being such a wretched blasphemer. How sad. At this point I think I have a right to bear a grudge, regardless of whether or not the divine exists."
Selle stands up, and shakes their head.
"I am forced to exist in this world, so I must play out my role. I just need to pick up the broken pieces of myself along the way. I'll figure it out."
They sigh.
"What do I do now..."
"Hey." Erik approaches.
"...Hey. Come to pity the pitiful?"
"Nah. I don’t have time for that." He smirks. "I leave the pity to the people who can afford it."

Selle shrugs.
"...How's Laura?"
"Handling the card. It’s a magic deck, if that wasn’t obvious. Crazy powerful too, I’ve never seen something that thoroughly imbued with power."
"What a pain." Selle brushes off their clothes. "Well, there's probably a reason you came over here. Should we go back to her? Or did you have something to say to me personally."
"I guess it’s more like a question. What’s your deal? Who *are* you, exactly?" He shrugs. "You’ve asked my deal quite a few times now but I can’t say I’ve got any clue what you’re doing either."

Selle averts their gaze a bit.
"You know, that's a tough question. I don't mind talking about it though, maybe it'll get something off my chest."
Selle focuses their gaze a bit, but not exactly onto Erik.
"I do wonder what my deal is. What exactly do you want to know? I can give you details if you ask. I can't just trauma dump my entire life onto you and expect you to handle it, you know? Even though I just did that."
"Ha. Don’t worry, I’m sure I’ll be fine."

"Well, I'll start here. I'm 21 years old. That's something I'm sure of. That makes me well over, a grown adult. If you were to ask me any other concrete details about myself, that would be tough to answer.  I guess the quickest answer would be, to say 'what my deal' is. I'm sure you already know this from my attitude towards certain things but I don't believe in God. Wow, shocker. But I think the reasons that led to that is what actually matters. It's not like I'm some contrarian raring to deny the existence of God because I decided to be spiteful. Well, maybe that's not entirely untrue, I am spiteful."
*I deserve to be though.*
"But, really, I hate our society. Really, I do. Partly due to some sort of idealism within me but most definitely because of what happened to me 9 years ago. 9 years ago, my world was shattered. A small and sad world. Propped up by falsities and abuse. A strict existence that adheres to the strictest of mores."
Selle unwinds the bandage on their right arm.
"Take a look.  I've mentioned it to you before, in passing."
The arm is ashy in colour, with distinctly much darker skin than the rest of their body.
"This is considered 'mutant'. It's an uncurable illness. My body eats at itself constantly if I don't take medicine. I got it one day, very suddenly. I.. don't know how it got passed onto me, but it doesn't matter. Anyway, in a society like ours, people who are considered 'mutants' aren't exactly treated kindly. When my parents found out about this, they panicked. They claimed, I was 'tainted', and that I had been forsaken by the divine. How pitiful. But, since I was raised in this same household, I trusted my parents when they said that I can be fixed- Agh."
Selle clutched at their head.
"...The rest is a bit fuzzy. I just know that they were told that I can't be fixed. Afterwards, they decided that I had to be offered up as a sacrifice to the divine. I'm not sure if there's any scripture that actually commands this, but, they were really in over their head for this whole religion thing. Regardless... That's the part I don't remember well. I just remember a lot of yelling and rain. That whole few weeks of my life is a blur. I just remember that one day, I started 'existing' as someone else. Someone that wasn't-.

.......

 ...Here I am now, spiteful, full of idealism, and with a complete lack of a congruent identity, constantly on the verge of death. Truly, how pitiful."
Selle looks at Erik. 
"That's my answer to what my deal is. It might take more time for you to find out who I am."
"Huh." He thinks about it silently.

Selle coughs. 
"...was probably too much to say all at once. Any questions?"
"These people who did this to you… Were you under the impression it was the AMO?"
"...That was my impression after all this time, yeah."
"I don’t think so. As much as they pretend to, that’s not actually how they operate."
"Interesting. Tell me more."
"Ever heard of a place called Site 17?"
"...I haven't. Go on."

"It’s an orphanage of sorts. They take kids who are burdened with mutations or magic from people they kill or who’ve been given to them by parents who want nothing to do with it. And while most people assume they kill them, the truth’s a lot grittier. They raise them into devout followers of the AMO who don’t value their lives whatsoever beyond fulfilling what they’re asked to do. That would’ve been your fate."
"Just how do you know all this... I wonder what really happened back then. My memory is fuzzy of that time so it could've been that I almost ended up there but, if it isn't them, then, what was it?"
"No clue. I just know a guy in the AMO. Not a friend, mind you… Think of it as a longterm enemy."

"What a mess it all is. I do want to learn the truth, eventually. Just, need to figure out how." 
Selle clutches their head.
"Anything else you want to know, or should we head back now?"

"Yeah. We need a plan." Erik

Jonald Triden just. Walks up to you. In the middle of the catacombs. He looks very confused.

*What?*
"What? ...Hello?"
Selle is taken aback and quickly stuffs their bandages into their pockets, and pulls their sleeve down.

"Kiddo… You the guy?" Jonald.

Erik takes out his sword. "What?"
"The... general?"

Selle is alert.
*What's up with this guy?*

Jonald Triden takes out a giant halberd. "I’ve gotta avenge- Murder’s bad. Don’t do th- Jack ain’t shit."

((Roll initiative))
It’s Selle’s turn.

"What the fuck is this guys problem? Is he saying I'm the killer again, damn it!"
Selle throws the bandages at Jonald and casts Fire Bolt, trying to set them on fire and hit Jonald.
((Roll dexterity I think? For the bandages))
(sure)
((18 for accuracy (fire bolt) 8 for bandages (dex), 5 for damage (fire bolt)))

The fire bolt hits his armour, damaging it slightly. The bandages don’t hit.

Erik attempts to stab him, but the armour magically bounces it back. "Shit. He’s immune to physical attacks. I’ll hold him back, you break his armour."

Jonald goes in for a massive swing on Erik, clearly dealing enough damage to knock Selle out in a single blow if he hits Selle.
It’s Selle’s turn.

"Shit, I missed the bandages."
Selle casts Fire Bolt at Jonald again.
(23 for accuracy, 9 for damage)

It hits again, straining the armour further.

Erik goes for another strike that also bounces off the armour.

"Saw a bloody massacre on- here. You- That isn’t funny, y’know?" Jonald strikes Erik once again.

It’s Selle’s turn.

"This guy is completely incomprehensible..."
Selle casts Fire Bolt at Jonald, once more.
(20 for accuracy, 9 for damage)
((Wait I only just realized I never gave you xp for the fight yesterday. You should've gotten 450xp))
(( oh im level 2 !))
(( it should be fine to just continue)

It hits. 

"I hate stubborn old guys." Erik strikes him again unsuccessfully.

Jonald misses his attack.

It’s Selle’s turn.

"He's a real pain in the ass."
Selle casts Fire Bolt again.
(20 acc, 6 hit)

The armour finally crumbles to ash. 

Erik buries his sword into Jonald’s chest. "There. No more old lunatic." He pulls out the blades and limps away.

Jonald just swings his halberd into Erik’s back. "Don’t count out the champ yet."

It’s Selle’s turn.

"Ahhhhh!!"
Selle runs at Jonald, and shoves him, trying to push him onto the floor while he's distracted.
(nat 1 for hit)

Selle slips and falls. 

Erik decapitates Jonald, ending initiative. "Shit…" He crumples to the ground.
"Urgh... That was a bad idea. Erik, are you okay?!"
“Fuck… I can see why he held onto his job so long. At the very least that’s one less guy who could take me on in the world, heh."
"Shit, his head is gone. I wanted to question him. Why the fuck did he just show up?!" Selle gets up and runs over to Erik.
"I wouldn’t be surprised if even he had no idea. Shit…"
"...Let's go back to Laura and discuss it then. How badly injured are you? I left all the medical supplies back there."
"I’ll… Try." ((End session))
((Oh and 700xp))
"I’ll… Try.”

"...Erik?"
Selle's blood starts to run cold.
*Fuck? What the hell? What's up with that stupid fucking geezer showing up?!*
Selle tries to examine Erik's physical condition.
((Roll medicine))
He should be able to make it but he's very hurt. He'll need a long rest.

Selle tries to put Erik around their shoulders to help him get to where Laura is.
"Thank god we aren't that far away... Let's go... Urgh"
"...Thanks. You're a better guy than I expected, honestly." ((Roll strength))
They manage to walk together.

"...This place is ridiculous. What are the chances the general shows up when I just wanted a moment alone. ...What a fucked up day."
Selle carries Erik to where they were before Selle went off, looking for Laura.
"I doubt it was a coincidence."
"You think it's related to the Hellhounds? Hah... What a hassle."

"Not... Quite." He's silent for a moment. "I have no doubt that he's senile enough that he screwed up whatever he was trying to do... But there were a hell of a lot of people around here he could've been tailing. Have you heard the general's alibi?"
"If I remember right, there hasn't been any information on where he's been for ages..."
"He was absent during the stabbing. I heard the church people actually think he did it. He's not smart enough for that, though... I think he met the culprit. That's why he was busy."

"Ugh... That means our one lead on the culprit is gone now."
Selle scratches her head.
"I wonder if someone from the Order would be our best lead for information, now that the general is dead. But they're impossible to even approach.... Let's just get to Laura and discuss it there."

"You don't understand, heh... What I'm saying is... Who was he trying to tail and kill? Who did he come here for before he forgot? The general doesn't go tailing people alone unless he knows something massive he can't tell his followers. Like, for example... A would be imperial assassin with powerful ties."

"Oh, that's what you were getting at. My head's a mess."
Selle ponders for a moment.
"Tailing, huh. You bring up a good point. It makes me wonder if we've crossed paths with the assassin at some point."

"Chances are they were just here. If they were a dead Craig family gangster, they would've been working for the Craig family. Which means the suspects are the Craig family, Donald Jameson working for the Hellhounds, that cursed baby, or maybe even *Laura*."
"He was stabbed through the chest with a sword though right? None of the people you mentioned seem to have much proficiency with swords. I wonder if that's just a red herring."

Selle looks at Erik being a sword user.
"You would know, right? You use a sword to fight. I suppose if you weren't there you wouldn't know about the circumstances though."

"I didn't know about that sword part." He does the biggest shrug he can manage. "People can learn more than 1 discipline though. It's not like that firing squad had any reason to pull out a sword and attack when they were already in position to hang back."
"I suppose you're not wrong. It'd be good to keep an eye out for signs of someone *being* a sword user at all, though."

"If that's what you were implying... I'd like to remind you I spent that night buried under rubble across town until you found me. But if you'd prefer..." He unsheathes his sword and holds the hilt so that Selle can take it.
"No, it's fine. We already did a trust exercise. I'd rather you keep your weapon on you since you're injured."
"We did?" He smiles with an indecipherable expression and puts away his sword.

"...Something like that. Either way, if it would have been you after all this time, I'd just swallow my pride and accept it."
Selle looks away and back.
"I would like to know more about what *your* deal is in general, though."
"...What do you know about the world outside of Athelates?"
"Not much."

"Makes sense. Most Soltarians don't actually know what their government is doing outside of this territory. There's an empire down there, the Meleke. Well... They don't call themselves an empire, but Soltarian doesn't quite have the right word for it."

"We were filthy rich. The Meleke were sitting on top of a literal goldmine, but those weren't the only precious materials there. We like to think we were the commercial hub of the entire continent and maybe even the world. Chances are that's a bit of unearned pride but we did have a lot of pride as a people. That's when the *mansa*- Sorry, the emperor I guess?- decided to get a little too close to your emperor. That's when everything started to go wrong. Suddenly all our neighbors decided they were too good for the epicenter of the economic world and the venators we'd pay so our people wouldn't have to go to war themselves vanished. With trade dead we were fucked and bandits were rapidly dwindling our existing supplies. So when the Soltarian flag came to promise us a new home under them and the guarantees of always having a trading partner and a trained army... Most people saw it as a mercy. I wasn't that old but I wasn't one of the sheep. I knew when our riches were given as absurd 'reconciliation' presents to those who'd stabbed us in the back that your empire had a promising investment in us using our own money."
"After that, there wasn't really anything to do in Meleke. So I just took a long vacation, I guess. I travelled. It's nothing that interesting."
"Meleke, huh. Must be unfortunate to be wrapped up in all of this Soltarian political nonsense after all this time then."
"I can't say I care that much." He tenses up slightly.

"If you're so sure."
Selle notices Erik tensing up.
"Are you feeling alright? How bad is the injury?"

"What am I supposed to answer to that? Pretty bad?"

They arrive back at the room with the corpses.

Selle shrugs, then covers her nose and mouth for a moment as they enter the room, to cover the smell.
"...Makes me sick. Where's Laura?"
"Back at base, maybe?"
"That would make sense. I don't want to spend more time than necessary around all of these corpses. Let's keep going."
They continue. "What's your plan, exactly? Once we kill Grognaut."
They continue. "What's your plan, exactly? Once we kill Grognaut."

"...Putting aside whether that is even at all possible, I'm not sure. Ideally, I'd like to figure out who the actual killer of the Emperor was, but that still wouldn't help with the current situation. Of course, my plan as a whole still stays to expose the corruption of the Order, but that's more of a grand scheme than a plan."
Selle scratches their head.
"In the end, it'll be about figuring it out as it unfolds. It'd be nice to take control of my own fate here, but recent events have really made a mess of my head. What about you?"
"More travels, I suppose. The right courses of action have a way of finding me."
"That's honorable. You do seem like a mysterious person when it comes to your motives though, I have to wonder why you seem to be so obsessed with Grognaut, but it seems like a sensitive topic."
"Ha." He doesn't elaborate. "What about the acting emperor? Planning to do anything to him?"

*Yeah, I knew he would just brush it off like that. I don't think I'll get anything out of him directly.*
"It already feels like everything will collapse under him without my direct interference, but if push comes to shove, it might be good to do something. As for what... Well, the time will come to decide. As a policy though, I don't kill. I don't want to stoop to his level. He deserves to suffer, so death is too much of an easy way out for him."
"You think emperors suffer?"
"There's ways to make anyone suffer."
"Like what?"

"There's plenty ways to make someone pay for their crimes. Whether it's humane or not is irrelevant, torture is an abundant aspect of human psychology to inflict suffering onto a person.
